Repositories: Your Project‚Äôs Home

A repository (repo) is a project container that includes:

  • All your code and files
  • Complete Git history
  • Issues, PRs, and discussions
  • Wiki and documentation
  • Settings and access controls

Repository Visibility

Visibility Who Can See Use Case
Public Anyone Open source projects
Private Invited collaborators Proprietary code
Internal Anyone in organization Shared company code (Enterprise)

Key Repository Components

my-repository/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅ Code (files and folders)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìã Issues (work tracking)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üîÄ Pull Requests (code changes)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ö° Actions (automation)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìä Projects (planning boards)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìñ Wiki (documentation)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üí¨ Discussions (community)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üîí Security (alerts, scanning)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚öôÔ∏è Settings (configuration)

Issues: Tracking Work

Issues are GitHub‚Äôs universal work tracker. Use them for:

  • üêõ Bug reports
  • ‚ú® Feature requests
  • üìã Tasks and to-dos
  • üí¨ Questions and discussions
  • üìù Documentation needs

Anatomy of an Issue

flowchart TB subgraph ISSUE["üêõ Issue #42: Login button not working on mobile"] direction TB META["Labels: bug, high-priority, mobile
Assignee: @developer
Milestone: v2.0 Release
Project: Q4 Sprint 3"] DESC["Description
Users report the login button is unresponsive...

Steps to Reproduce
1. Open site on iPhone Safari
2. Tap login button
3. Nothing happens"] ENGAGE["üí¨ Comments (5)    üîó Linked PR: #45"] end META --> DESC --> ENGAGE

Issue Templates

Organizations can create templates for consistent issue reporting:

  • Bug Report ‚Äî Steps to reproduce, expected vs actual behavior
  • Feature Request ‚Äî Problem statement, proposed solution
  • Question ‚Äî Context, what you‚Äôve tried

Labels: Organizing Issues

Labels categorize issues with colored tags:

Common Label Patterns

Label Purpose
bug Something isn‚Äôt working
enhancement New feature request
documentation Documentation improvements
good first issue Easy tasks for new contributors
help wanted Needs community assistance
priority: high Urgent attention needed
status: in progress Currently being worked on

Label Strategy Tips

  • Use consistent naming conventions
  • Limit to 3-4 labels per issue
  • Color-code by category (red for bugs, blue for features)
  • Document label meanings in contributing guide

Pull Requests: The Heart of Collaboration

A Pull Request (PR) is how code changes get reviewed and merged.

Pull Request Workflow

flowchart LR B["1Ô∏è‚É£ Create branch
feature/add-login"] --> C["2Ô∏è‚É£ Make changes
Commits on branch"] C --> PR["3Ô∏è‚É£ Open PR
Request merge"] PR --> R["4Ô∏è‚É£ Review
Team reviews"] R --> F["5Ô∏è‚É£ Address feedback
Make changes"] F --> A["6Ô∏è‚É£ Approve
Reviewer approves"] A --> M["7Ô∏è‚É£ Merge
Changes to main"] M --> D["8Ô∏è‚É£ Delete branch
Clean up"]

Anatomy of a Pull Request

flowchart TB subgraph PR["üîÄ PR: Add user authentication system"] direction TB BRANCH["feature/user-auth ‚Üí main"] DESC["üìù Description
This PR adds OAuth2 authentication...
Closes #42"] CHECKS["‚úÖ Checks passed (3/3)
‚Ä¢ Build succeeded
‚Ä¢ Tests passed (142 tests)
‚Ä¢ Security scan clean"] META["üë• Reviewers: @senior-dev ‚úì
üè∑Ô∏è Labels: enhancement, authentication"] end BRANCH --> DESC --> CHECKS --> META

Code Review

Reviewers can: - Comment ‚Äî Ask questions, suggest improvements - Approve ‚Äî Code looks good to merge - Request Changes ‚Äî Blocking issues must be addressed

GitHub Projects: Planning Work

Projects provide Kanban-style boards and tables for planning.

Project Views

View Type Best For
Board Kanban workflow (To Do ‚Üí In Progress ‚Üí Done)
Table Spreadsheet-style data view
Roadmap Timeline planning

Project Features

  • Custom fields ‚Äî Priority, size, sprint
  • Automation ‚Äî Move items when status changes
  • Filtering ‚Äî View specific items
  • Grouping ‚Äî Organize by assignee, label, status
  • Insights ‚Äî Charts and metrics

Milestones: Tracking Releases

Milestones group issues and PRs toward a goal:

flowchart TB subgraph MILESTONE["üéØ Milestone: v2.0 Release"] DUE["Due: December 31, 2025"] PROGRESS["Progress: ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñë‚ñë 80%"] STATS["Open: 4 issues, 2 PRs
Closed: 16 issues, 8 PRs"] end

GitHub Discussions

Discussions enable community conversation outside of issues:

Discussion Categories

Category Use Case
Announcements Project news (maintainer posts)
General Open conversation
Ideas Feature brainstorming
Q&A Questions with accepted answers
Show and Tell Share what you‚Äôve built

Discussions vs Issues

Discussions Issues
Open-ended conversation Trackable work items
Community engagement Bug reports, features
Q&A format available Assignable to developers
No close date Can be closed

Repository Settings

Key settings CSMs should know:

Features Toggle

  • Issues on/off
  • Projects on/off
  • Wiki on/off
  • Discussions on/off

Access & Security

  • Collaborator permissions
  • Branch protection rules
  • Deploy keys
  • Webhooks

Merge Settings

  • Allow merge commits
  • Allow squash merging
  • Allow rebase merging
  • Auto-delete head branches

GitHub Mobile

GitHub Mobile brings the GitHub experience to iOS and Android devices, enabling developers to stay connected to their work from anywhere.

Key Mobile Features

Feature Capability
Notifications Triage, filter, and respond to notifications
Issues Create, read, comment, and close issues
Pull Requests Review code, approve PRs, merge changes
Discussions Participate in community conversations
Search Find repositories, issues, users, and code
Profile View activity, contributions, and followers

Mobile-Specific Features

  • Push notifications - Real-time alerts for mentions, reviews, CI status
  • Swipe gestures - Quick actions on notifications and issues
  • Dark mode - Follows system theme preference
  • Face ID / Touch ID - Secure authentication
  • Home screen widgets - Contribution graph, notifications count

Best Use Cases for Mobile

‚úÖ Great for: - Triaging notifications during commute - Quick code review approvals - Responding to urgent issues - Checking CI/CD status - Team communication on the go

‚ö†Ô∏è Better on desktop: - Writing significant code - Complex merge conflict resolution - Detailed code review with line comments - Repository administration

CSM Talking Point

‚ÄúGitHub Mobile turns waiting time into productive time. Your developers can triage notifications, approve reviews, and stay connected without opening their laptop.‚Äù

Visual Summary

üé® Key Concepts at a Glance
**Repository**: Project container with code, history, and collaboration tools **Issue**: Work item (bug, feature, task) with labels and assignees **Pull Request**: Code change proposal with review workflow **Project**: Kanban board or table for planning work **Milestone**: Groups issues/PRs toward a deadline **Discussion**: Community conversation outside issues **Codespaces**: Cloud development environment in your browser **GitHub Mobile**: iOS/Android app for on-the-go access

Now let‚Äôs take a guided tour of the GitHub interface to see these features in action.
